title: Smart blue background theme via Tailwind CSS variable tokens

requirements.summary: Shift the global surface and primary palette from warm-neutral to a cohesive smart-corporate blue by updating theme CSS variables and ensuring section/background variants render consistently across key pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Light mode background, muted, and accent surfaces use a cohesive smart-blue tint (not warm beige/neutral).
Primary interactive elements (e.g., primary buttons, focus rings, primary icons) reflect the updated smart-blue palette and remain readable with sufficient contrast.
Pages Home, Services, About, and Contact consistently reflect the updated background theme without breaking layout or readability.

file_operations.description: Update light/dark mode OKLCH CSS variables (e.g., --background, --foreground, --primary, --ring, --muted, --accent, --border/input) from the current warm-neutral hues to a cohesive smart-blue direction; validate contrast for text, primary controls, and focus rings across light mode surfaces.

Tune Section variant surface treatments (muted/accent background utility usage and opacity) so muted/accent sections clearly read as smart-blue tinted surfaces while preserving readability and existing layout (no routing/page changes).

Verify top navigation background and focus ring styling continues to look modern and readable with the updated smart-blue tokens (bg-background translucency, ring color, border tint); make token-based class adjustments only if any contrast/regression appears after the palette change.

Verify footer muted background and borders render as smart-blue (not warm) with updated tokens; adjust token-based utility usage only if needed to keep consistent section separation and text contrast.
